reference.title: Getting a destination cluster reference
reference.shortdesc: To retrieve an XDCR reference to a destination cluster, use the GET /pools/default/remoteClusters HTTP method and URI.

section.title: Description
section.p: To use XDCR, source and destination clusters must be established. A source cluster is the cluster where the original data is stored. A destination cluster is the cluster where the replica data is stored. Data is copied from the source cluster to the destination cluster.

section.title: Example
section.p: When requesting the remote cluster reference, provide credentials for the local cluster and the hostname and port for the remote cluster.
section.codeblock: GET /pools/default/remoteClusters HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Basic QWRtaW5pc3RyYXRvcjpwYXNzd29yZA== User-Agent: curl/7.21.4 (universal-apple-darwin11.0) libcurl/7.21.4 OpenSSL/0.9.8r zlib/1.2.5 Host: 10.4.2.4:8091 Accept: */*

section.title: Response
section.p: If successful, Couchbase Server responds with a JSON response similar to the following:
The following describes the response elements:

ul.li: (String) name: Name of the destination cluster referenced for XDCR.
(String) uri: URI for destination cluster information.
(String) validateURI: URI to validate details of cluster reference.
(String) hostname: Hostname/IP (and :port) of the remote cluster.
(String) uuid: UUID of the remote cluster reference.
(String) username: Username for the destination cluster administrator.
(Boolean) deleted: Indicates whether the reference to the destination cluster has been deleted or not.
